title: Atlanta's Best Haunted Places
name: Atlanta's Best Haunted Places
description:
A Map by Us3rname

Map created from Joy Johnston's list on About.com

Atlanta is a city rich in history, and local folklore can point to many haunted places, from little girls lost at Six Flags, to a haunted restaurant in Buckhead. Please heed all laws while attempting to explore these places, as many are not open to the public or only during set hours. Otherwise, you might find yourself in another scary place- jail.

*****

Halloween, haunted, ghost, paranormal, scary, fright, fun, cemetery, ghouls

properties.name: Anthony's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 3109 Piedmont Rd Ne, Atlanta, GAThis popular Buckhead institution is reportedly haunted by a woman named Annie Barnett Bean, who died in childbirth at the house.

properties.name: Devil's Turnaround Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname+33.991, -84.574Another well-known spooky spot in metro Atlanta, supposedly some of the spirits in the oddly shaped graveyard become violent when approached by those with crosses or Bibles. The tombstones in the heavily wooded "turnaround" area date back to the Civil War era.

properties.name: Holliday-Dorsey-Fife House Museum
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  140 Lanier Ave. W. Fayetteville, GeorgiaThis house turned historical museum supposedly has a resident ghost. It also has ties to Doc Holliday and Margaret Mitchell.

properties.name: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname900 Kennesaw Mountain Drive, Kennesaw, GeorgiaReported to be haunted by Confederate soldiers. The park has set hours and is heavily patrolled by security, so exploring at night is not recommended and at your own risk.

properties.name: Masquerade
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 695 North Ave Ne, Atlanta, GAThe Goth dance club that\'s being sold to residential developers has a long and supposedly creepy history. Some say a vampire actually lives on the premises. It was a former mill, where numerous tragic accidents and deaths took place, and over the years, the building has been plagued by fires and other calamities.

properties.name: Miner Ghost
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameToluca, IllinoisThis Ghost was only see by the kids of the family. We did get some EVPS

properties.name: Mousley House
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameLanghorneGhostly sightings, people dying for unknown reasons, dolls making strange sounds

properties.name: Oakland Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname248 Oakland Ave Se, Atlanta, GAOakland Cemetery is said to be haunted by the spirits of Civil War soldiers that are buried there. The "tomb of the unknown" is where most hauntings are witnessed. via About.com

properties.name: Six Flags Over Georgia
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname275 Riverside Parkway Austell, GAThere have been many interesting sightings around this popular metro Atlanta amusement park. The gas station at the park\'s entrance is said to be haunted by a young girl, and the Crystal Pistol Music Hall is said to be haunted by a performer who was killed in a car accident before he had the chance to take stage.

properties.name: Stone Moutain Park
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnamePO BOX 778, STONE MOUNTAIN, GA, 30086Several rooms of the Antebellum Plantation at Stone Mountain Park are said to be haunted. While in the area, stop at the cemetery located at the end of Main Street, for what ghost hunters claim is an area with frequent paranormal experiences and sightings.

properties.name: The Fox Theater
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 660 Peachtree St Ne, Atlanta, GAPeople have reportedly seen ghost sightings at Atlanta\'s famed multi-purpose theatre in Midtown, including the face of a Confederate Private soldier. via About.com

properties.name: The Georgia Retardation Center (Brook Run)
properties.description: Posted by Us3rnameLocated behind a Dunwoody office park, this former hospital has become quite a local attraction for ghost hunters. It\'s not open to the public, and a security guard patrols the area, so go at your own risk. Highlights include a sighting of a boy on the third floor.
